notes: Bear is expected to be out for at least a few weeks due to his undisclosed injury, per PuckPedia on Saturday.

The Sabres said on Friday (Oct. 3) that Kesselring is week-to-week. He will be re-evaluated next week.
The Sabres said on Friday (Oct. 3) that Luukkonen is week-to-week. He will be re-evaluated next week.
The Oilers said on Friday (Oct. 3) that Janmark will miss one week of action according to head coach Kris Knoblauch, per Jason Gregor of Sports 1440 Edmonton.
The Detroit Redwings placed F Nate Danielson on Injured Reserve. Danielson sustained an undisclosed injury versus the Sabres on Saturday (Sept. 29) and has no timetable to return.
The Detroit Red Wings placed D Shai Buium on injured reserve on Thursday (Oct. 2).
The Penguins said on Thursday (Oct. 2) that Rust will miss a minimum of two weeks with a lower-body injury.

The Flyers said on Wednesday (Oct. 1) that Bonk will be OUT for approximately two weeks.

Stephenson is OUT for Monday's (Sep. 29) game against Calgary.

The Mammoth said on Friday (Sept. 19) that Kerfoot will be listed as week-to-week due to a lower-body injury.

The Sharks said on Thursday (Sept. 25) that Carlsson has returned to the ice but will not play in training camp, per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now.

The Kings said on Friday (Sept. 19) that Booth is month-to-month after leaving Thursday's (Sept. 18) scrimmage because of a lower-body injury, head coach Jim Hiller told John Hoven of SiriusXM NHL Network Radio.
The Rangers said that Panarin has started skating but remains out of the lineup ahead of Tuesday's (Sept. 23) matchup versus the Bruins, per Vince Z. Mercogliano of The Athletic.

General manager Jim Nill said on Wednesday (Sept. 17) that Krys is expected to be sidelined until January or February due to an Achilles injury, per Owen Newkirk of DLLS Sports.
General manager Jim Nill said on Wednesday (Sept. 17) that McDonald will be out until at least November after undergoing ACL surgery, per Owen Newkirk of DLLS Sports.
General manager Jim Nill said on Wednesday (Sept. 17) that Wheatcroft will likely be out until mid-October due to a wrist injury, per Owen Newkirk of DLLS Sports.
